org.openimaj.image.feature.local.descriptor.gradient

Class IrregularBinningSIFTFeatureProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.feature.local.descriptor.gradient.IrregularBinningSIFTFeatureProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FeatureVectorProvider<OrientedFeatureVector>, GradientFeatureProvider, GradientFeatureProviderFactory, LocalFeatureProvider<OrientedFeatureVector>

    @Reference(type=Inproceedings,
           author={"Cui, Yan","Hasler, Nils","Thorm\"{a}hlen, Thorsten","Seidel, Hans-Peter"},
           title="Scale Invariant Feature Transform with Irregular Orientation Histogram Binning",
           year="2009",
           booktitle="Proceedings of the 6th International Conference on Image Analysis and Recognition",
           pages={"258","","267"},
           publisher="Springer-Verlag",
           series="ICIAR \'09",
           customData={"Address","Berlin, Heidelberg"})
public class IrregularBinningSIFTFeatureProvider
extends Object
implements GradientFeatureProvider, GradientFeatureProviderFactory
    Irregular binning SIFT descriptor based on this paper: CuiHasThoSei09igSIFT.pdf
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

        public IrregularBinningSIFTFeatureProvider(int numOriBins)
        Construct a IrregularBinningSIFTFeatureExtractor with the default parameters.
        Parameters:
        numOriBins - the number of orientation bins (default 8)

      • IrregularBinningSIFTFeatureProvider

        public IrregularBinningSIFTFeatureProvider(int numOriBins,
                                   float valueThreshold)
        Construct a IrregularBinningSIFTFeatureExtractor with the default parameters.
        Parameters:
        numOriBins - the number of orientation bins (default 8)
        valueThreshold - threshold for the maximum value allowed in the histogram (default 0.2)

    • Method Detail

      • addSample

        public void addSample(float x,
             float y,
             float gradmag,
             float gradori)
        Description copied from interface: GradientFeatureProvider
        Add a sample to the feature. The x and y coordinates are given in terms of a unit index square (i.e. 0<=x<=1 and 0<=y<=1).
        Specified by:
        addSample in interface GradientFeatureProvider
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate within the unit indexing square
        y - y-coordinate within the unit indexing square
        gradmag - the gradient magnitude at the given coordinate
        gradori - the gradient direction at the given coordinate

      • assignOri

      • getFeatureVector

        public OrientedFeatureVector getFeatureVector()
        Specified by:

        Specified by:
        getFeatureVector in interface GradientFeatureProvider

      • setPatchOrientation

        public void setPatchOrientation(float patchOrientation)
        Description copied from interface: GradientFeatureProvider
        Set the primary orientation of the sample patch in the image being processed. This might be used by concrete implementations to provide rotation invariance. This method should only be called once by calling code, and the call should be before any calls to GradientFeatureProvider.addSample(float, float, float, float) are made.
        Specified by:
        setPatchOrientation in interface GradientFeatureProvider
        Parameters:
        patchOrientation - the actual orientation of the square in the image

      • newProvider

        public GradientFeatureProvider newProvider()
        Description copied from interface: GradientFeatureProviderFactory
        Construct a new GradientFeatureProvider implementation with all its internal settings setup ready for use.
        Specified by:
        newProvider in interface GradientFeatureProviderFactory
        Returns:
        a new GradientFeatureProvider implementation.

      • getOversamplingAmount

        public float getOversamplingAmount()
        Description copied from interface: LocalFeatureProvider
        Get the amount of required over-sampling outside of the unit square patch. An oversampling of 0.5 would result in methods such as SIFTFeatureProvider#addSample(float, float, float, float) being called with pixels in the range -0.5 to 1.5.
        Specified by:
        getOversamplingAmount in interface LocalFeatureProvider<OrientedFeatureVector>
        Returns:
        the amount over sampling above the unit square
